info.official_title: A Single-arm Phase I Clinical Study of TIL Injection for the Treatment of Metastatic or Recurrent Solid Tumors

identified_line.line: * 1. The Patients (or legally authorized representative) Patients (or legally authorized representative) must have the ability to understand the requirements of the study, have provided written informed consent as evidenced by signature on an informed consent form (ICF) approved by an Institutional Review Board/Independent Ethics Committee (IRB/IEC), must have the ability to understand the requirements of the study;

criterions.exact_snippets: ability to understand the requirements of the study
provided written informed consent as evidenced by signature on an informed consent form (ICF) approved by an Institutional Review Board/Independent Ethics Committee (IRB/IEC)

and_criteria.exact_snippets: ability to understand the requirements of the study
provided written informed consent as evidenced by signature on an informed consent form (ICF) approved by an Institutional Review Board/Independent Ethics Committee (IRB/IEC)

identified_line.line: * 2.Must have a confirmed diagnosis of malignancy of their receptive histologies or cytologies: unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor;

criterions.exact_snippets: confirmed diagnosis of malignancy
unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor
unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor
unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor

and_criteria.exact_snippets: unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor

or_criteria.exact_snippets: unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor
unresectable recurrent or metastatic solid tumor

identified_line.line: * 3.At least one resectable lesion (preferably superficial metastatic lymph nodes) that has not been treated with radiation and has not received other local therapies. The separated tissues mass weighing ≥0.5cm (either of single lesion origin or multiple lesions combined) for the preparation of autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes. Minimally invasive treatment where possible;

criterions.exact_snippets: At least one resectable lesion
preferably superficial metastatic lymph nodes
that has not been treated with radiation
has not received other local therapies
The separated tissues mass weighing ≥0.5cm
for the preparation of autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes
Minimally invasive treatment where possible

and_criteria.exact_snippets: that has not been treated with radiation
has not received other local therapies
for the preparation of autologous tumor-infiltrating lymphocytes

or_criteria.exact_snippets: preferably superficial metastatic lymph nodes
Minimally invasive treatment where possible

criterions.exact_snippets: Healthy volunteers allowed

identified_line.line: Must have minimum age of 18 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: minimum age of 18 Years

identified_line.line: Must have maximum age of 70 Years

criterions.exact_snippets: maximum age of 70 Years

identified_line.line: * 1. Patients who have symptomatic and/or untreated CNS metastases (Except stable brain metastases, no medication required within 3 months, no hormone dependence);

criterions.exact_snippets: symptomatic and/or untreated CNS metastases
symptomatic and/or untreated CNS metastases
stable brain metastases
no medication required within 3 months
no hormone dependence

identified_line.line: * 2.The patient who has any active autoimmune disease, history of autoimmune disease, need for systemic steroid hormones or a condition requiring immunosuppressive drug therapy (>10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent hormone);

criterions.exact_snippets: any active autoimmune disease
history of autoimmune disease
need for systemic steroid hormones
condition requiring immunosuppressive drug therapy (>10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent hormone)

or_criteria.exact_snippets: need for systemic steroid hormones
condition requiring immunosuppressive drug therapy (>10 mg/day of prednisone or equivalent hormone)

identified_line.line: * 3. Arterial/venous thrombotic events within 5 months prior to enrollment, such as: cerebrovascular accident, deep vein thrombosis and pulmonary embolism occurring;

criterions.exact_snippets: Arterial/venous thrombotic events within 5 months prior to enrollment
Arterial/venous thrombotic events within 5 months prior to enrollment
cerebrovascular accident
deep vein thrombosis
pulmonary embolism

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Arterial/venous thrombotic events within 5 months prior to enrollment
Arterial/venous thrombotic events within 5 months prior to enrollment

or_criteria.exact_snippets: cerebrovascular accident
deep vein thrombosis
pulmonary embolism

identified_line.line: * 4.Active infections requiring treatment with systemic anti-infectives (except for topical antibiotics); or those with unexplained fever > 38.5℃ occurring during the screening period, except for tumor fever;

criterions.exact_snippets: Active infections requiring treatment with systemic anti-infectives
unexplained fever > 38.5℃ occurring during the screening period

and_criteria.exact_snippets: Active infections requiring treatment with systemic anti-infectives
unexplained fever > 38.5℃ occurring during the screening period

identified_line.line: * 5. Patients who have refractory or intractable epilepsy, hydrops abdominis, active gastrointestinal bleeding or IL-2 contraindications;

criterions.exact_snippets: refractory or intractable epilepsy
hydrops abdominis
active gastrointestinal bleeding
IL-2 contraindications

or_criteria.exact_snippets: active gastrointestinal bleeding
IL-2 contraindications

identified_line.line: * 6. Patients who have received allogeneic bone marrow transplantation or an organ allograft;

criterions.exact_snippets: Patients who have received allogeneic bone marrow transplantation
Patients who have received ... an organ allograft

or_criteria.exact_snippets: Patients who have received allogeneic bone marrow transplantation
Patients who have received ... an organ allograft

identified_line.line: * 7.Patients who have a history of hypersensitivity to any component or excipient of study drugs: autologous tumor infiltrating lymphocytes, cyclophosphamide, fludarabine, IL-2, dimethyl sulfoxide (DMSO), human serum albumin (HSA), dextran-40 and antibiotics (beta lactam antibiotics, gentamicin);

criterions.exact_snippets: history of hypersensitivity to any component or excipient of study drugs: autologous tumor infiltrating lymphocytes
criterions.criterion: hypersensitivity to autologous tumor infiltrating lymphocytes
